stimulusHtml: Which of the following correctly indicates whether the student’s claim is correct or incorrect, and provides a valid justification?

features.html: A sample of an ideal monatomic gas is sealed in a container of fixed volume. The temperature of the gas decreases. A student claims that the speed of every gas atom decreases as the temperature of the gas decreases.

choicesHtml: Correct, because the average kinetic energy of the gas atoms decreases and the kinetic energy of every gas atom will decrease.
Correct, because the rate of collisions between the gas atoms and the container wall will decrease.
Incorrect, because the average kinetic energy of the gas atoms decreases but any individual atom’s energy may increase or decrease due to random processes.
Incorrect, because the average kinetic energy of the gas atoms will not change because the volume of the container is not changing.
